BiblioData.Title: NAPHTHALENE BASED TETRACARBOXYLIC DIIMIDES AS SEMICONDUCTOR MATERIALS
BiblioData.Abstract: A thin film transistor comprises a layer of organic semiconductor material comprising a tetracarboxylic diimide naphthalene-based compound having, attached to each of the imide nitrogen atoms, a substituted or unsubstituted alicyclic ring system, optionally substituted with electron donating groups. Such transistors can further comprise spaced apart first and second contact means or electrodes in contact with said material. Further disclosed is a process for fabricating an organic thin-film transistor device, preferably by sublimation deposition onto a substrate, wherein the substrate temperature is no more than 100 DEG C.

Claims.P: 1. An article comprising, in a thin film transistor, a thin film of organic semiconductor material that comprises an N,N'-dicycloalkyl-substituted naphthalene tetracarboxylic diimide compound having an uncyanated naphthalene core and, directly attached to each imide nitrogen in the compound, a first and second alicyclic ring system, each having 4 to 10 ring carbons, wherein there are optionally one or more substituents independently on each of the alicyclic ring systems and the naphthalene core, wherein any substituents on each alicyclic ring system in the compound independently comprises at least one electron donating organic substituent.
2. The article of claim 1, wherein the N,N'-dicycloalkyl-substituted naphthalene tetracarboxylic diimide compound is represented by the following general structure I:
EMI16.0

wherein, A1 and A2 are independently a substituted or unsubstituted alicyclic ring system comprising of 4 to 10 ring carbons in the ring system; and wherein m is any integer from 0 to 4 and Y groups are independently selected from electron donating groups that do not adversely affect the n-type semiconductor properties of the film made from such compounds.
3. The article of claim 1, wherein both of the first and the second alicyclic ring system, in said structure, are substituted with at least one electron donating group.

4. The article of claim 3 wherein either one or both of the first and the second alicyclic ring system are substituted by at least one electron donating group that is selected from CH3, linear or branched C2-C4 alkyl, alkenyl, alkoxy, or other electron donating organic group having 1 to 4 carbon atoms.

5. The article of claim 1 wherein the thin film transistor is a field effect transistor comprising a dielectric layer, a gate electrode, a source electrode and a drain electrode, and wherein the dielectric layer, the gate electrode, the thin film of organic semiconductor material, the source electrode, and the drain electrode are in any sequence as long as the gate electrode and the thin film of organic semiconductor material both contact the dielectric layer, and the source electrode and the drain electrode both contact the thin film of organic semiconductor material.
6. The article of claim 1 wherein the thin film of organic semiconductor material is capable of exhibiting electron mobility greater than 0.01 cm<2> /Vs.
7. The article of claim 1 wherein the alicylic ring systems are monocylic rings or bicyclic alicyclic hydrocarbon rings.
8. The article of claim 1 wherein the Y substituent groups on the naphthalene nucleus are selected from the group consisting of alkyl groups, alkenyl groups, and alkoxy groups.
9. The article of claim 1 wherein the alicylic ring system is a substituted or unsubstituted cyclohexyl or cyclopentyl ring.

10. The article of claim 1, wherein the thin film of organic semiconductor material comprises a N,N'-dicylcoalkyl-substituted-1,4,5,8-naphthalene tetracarboxylic acid diimide compound represented by the following structure:
EMI17.0

wherein, on a first of the two cyclohexyl rings in the above structure, R<1> , R<2> , R<3> , R<4> , and R<5> and, on a second of the two cyclohexyl rings, R<6> , R<7> , R<8> , R<9> , and R<10 > are each independently H or an organic substituent, allowing that optionally any two adjacent R groups on a ring system can combine to form a four to seven-membered substituted or unsubstituted ring as part of a bridged alicyclic ring system, wherein any substitution on an alicylic ring system in the compound includes at least one electron donating organic group; and, wherein Y is a substituent that is not electron withdrawing and does not adversely affect the effective semiconductor properties of the organic semiconductor material, and m is 0 to 4.
11. The article of claim 10 wherein all of R<1 > to R<10 > groups is hydrogen.
12. The article of claim 10 wherein both of the first and second alicyclic ring systems in the compound comprise at least one electron donating group that is an alkyl group.

13. The article of claim 10 wherein both of the alicylic ring systems in the structure are both monocylic alicylic ring systems having 5 to 6 carbon ring atoms, each independently unsubstituted or substituted with at least one electron donating group.

14. The article of claim 10 wherein either one or both of the first and the second alicyclic ring systems in the compound are cyclohexyl rings that are substituted by at least one electron donating group that is an alkyl group.

15. The article of claim 10, wherein in said structure R<1> , R<2> , R<3> , R<4> , R<5> , R<6> , R<7> , R<8> , R<9> , and R<10 > are each independently selected from H, CH3, linear or branched C2-C4 alkyl, alkenyl, alkoxy, or other electron donating organic group having 1to 4 carbon atoms.
16. The article of claim 10, wherein in said structure at least two of R<1> , R<2> , R<3> , R<4 > and R<5 > are H and at least two of R<6> R , R<7> , R<8> , R<9> , and R<10 > are H.
17. The article of claim 16, wherein in said structure at least three of R<1> ,R<2> , R<3> , R<4 > and R<5 > are H and at least three of R<6> , R<7> , R<8> , R<9> , and R<10 > are H.

18. The article of claim 10, wherein in said structure either all of R<1> , R<3> , R<4> , R<5> , R<6> , R<8> , R<9> , and R<10 > are H, and at least one of R<2 > and R<7 > is an alkyl group; or all of R<2> , R<3> , R<4> , R<5> , R<7> , R<8> , R<9> , and R<10 > are H, and at least one of R<1 > and R<6 > are CH3.

19. The article of claim 14, wherein there is exactly one independently selected electron donating organic substituent on each of the two cyclohexyl rings, and wherein either the substituents differ in identity and/or position or, if the substituents are the same in identity and position, the substituents are on in the ortho or metal position, not in the para position, on the cyclohexyl rings with respect to the imide nitrogen.
20. The article of claim 10 wherein the electron donating groups and/or the Y groups are independently selected from alkyl, alkenyl, and alkoxy groups.
21. The article of claim 1, wherein the thin film transistor has an on/off ratio of a source/drain current of at least 10<4> .

22. The article of claim 5, wherein the gate electrode is adapted for controlling, by means of a voltage applied to the gate electrode, a current between the source and drain electrodes through the thin film of organic semiconductor material.
23. The article of claim 5 wherein the dielectric layer comprises an inorganic or organic electrically insulating material.
24. The article of claim 1 wherein the thin film transistor further comprises a non-participating support that is optionally flexible.
25. The article of claim 5 wherein the source, drain, and gate electrodes each independently comprise a material selected from doped silicon, metal, and a conducting polymer.
26. An electronic device selected from the group consisting of integrated circuits, active-matrix display, and solar cells comprising a multiplicity of thin film transistors according to claim 1.
27. The electronic device of claim 26 wherein the multiplicity of the thin film transistors is on a non-participating support that is optionally flexible.
28. A process for fabricating a thin film semiconductor device, comprising, not necessarily in the following order, the steps of:

(a) depositing, onto a substrate, a thin film of n-channel organic semiconductor material that comprises an N,N'-dicycloalkyl-substituted-naphthalene tetracarboxylic diimide compound having an uncyanated naphthalene core and, attached directly to each imide nitrogen atom, a first and second alicyclic ring system, each having 4 to 10 ring carbons, wherein optionally there are one or more substituents on one or both of the alicyclic aromatic ring systems, which optional substituents if present include at least one electron donating organic substituent, such that the organic semiconductor material exhibits a field effect electron mobility that is greater than 0.01 cm<2> /Vs;

(b) forming a spaced apart source electrode and drain electrode, wherein the source electrode and the drain electrode are separated by, and electrically connected with, the n-channel semiconductor film; and
(c) forming a gate electrode spaced apart from the organic semiconductor material.
29. The process of claim 28, wherein said compound is deposited on the substrate by sublimation and wherein the substrate has a temperature of no more than 100[deg.] C. during deposition.
30. The process of claim 28, wherein the compound is N,N'-dicyclohexyl-naphthalene-1,4,5,8 tetracarboxylic acid diimide or N,N'-dicyclopentyl-naphthalene-1,4,5,8 tetracarboxylic acid diimide.
